responsibilities: Creating, updating, and maintaining threat models for a wide variety of software projects
Manual and automated secure code review, primarily in Java, Python, and Javascript
Adversarial security analysis using tools to augment manual effort
Security training and outreach for internal development teams
Lead execution and definition of security strategy for your team
Mentor and develop teammates both technically and professionally
Seek out, develop, and advocate for new technology to identify and mitigate complex risks
Effectively navigate novel situations and problems that do not have a defined solution
qualifications: Ability to lead by influence and communicate clearly
Security generalist with one or more areas of deep expertise
Ability to articulate risks to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to harmonize disparate opinions and prioritize risks
Experience with threat modeling, secure coding, identity management, authentication, software development, cryptography, penetration testing, cloud security, mobile security, and network security
Advanced knowledge of security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, or application security
Experience reading and writing in at least one programming language
Excellent judgment in assessing and prioritizing technical risk
Strong application security background with a focus on scalable solutions
Experience building and securing complex AWS architecture
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed are primarily focused on security engineering, threat modeling, secure coding, and security architecture. The responsibilities include creating threat models, conducting secure code reviews, developing security automation tools, and providing security training and guidance. The skills required include expertise in security engineering, cryptography, penetration testing, and cloud security, among others.

There is no mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on security practices, risk assessment, and technical leadership in security domains. While the job may involve some level of automation and tool development, there is no indication that these tools are related to GenAI or LLMs.

Therefore, based on the provided information, the job does not appear to involve working with Generative AI or language models.
